com.aurel.track.admin.customize.localize

Class LocalizeBL

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aurel.track.admin.customize.localize.LocalizeBL

  • public class LocalizeBL
extends java.lang.Object
    Business logic for implicitly loading/saving/deleting the localized texts

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  LocalizeBL.RESOURCE_CATEGORIES
      Main category: either DB entity or UI text
      static interface  LocalizeBL.RESOURCE_TYPE_KEYS
      Resource keys for locale editor
      static interface  LocalizeBL.RESOURCE_TYPES
      All hardcoded resource types are negative because there can be custom list with any positive listID

      • saveLocalizedResource

        public static void saveLocalizedResource(java.lang.String fieldName,
                         java.lang.Integer primaryKey,
                         java.lang.String label,
                         java.util.Locale locale)
        Set the same value also in the TLocalizedResources table with null (or for now "" (mandatory)) locale. The localization will be loaded from this table, and if not found, from the localized property files, and if not found there from the "native" table. The problem is that the correspondence is made through the key (which do not change) instead of values and localized property files use the same key for existing entries and then the renamed label is not visible because the localized property files have priority over those from the "native" table. This intermediate step is introduced to solve the problem until this localisation in database will be implemented also in the Web-Interface.
        Parameters:
        fieldName -
        primaryKey -
        label -
        locale -

      • saveSystemFieldLocalizedResource

        public static void saveSystemFieldLocalizedResource(int systemField,
                                    java.lang.Integer primaryKey,
                                    java.lang.String label,
                                    java.util.Locale locale)
        Set the same value also in the TLocalizedResources table with null (or for now "" (mandatory)) locale. The localization will be loaded from this table, and if not found, from the localized property files, and if not found there from the "native" table. The problem is that the correspondence is made through the key (which do not change) instead of values and localized property files use the same key for existing entries and then the renamed label is not visible because the localized property files have priority over those from the "native" table. This intermediate step is introduced to solve the problem until this localisation in database will be implemented also in the Web-Interface.
        Parameters:
        systemField -
        primaryKey -
        label -

      • saveSystemStateLocalizedResource

        public static void saveSystemStateLocalizedResource(int systemState,

                                    java.lang.String label,
                                    java.util.Locale locale)

      • saveResources

        public static void saveResources(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                 java.lang.String locale,
                 boolean overwrite,
                 java.lang.Integer importTarget,
                 boolean initBoxResources)
        Parameters:
        inputStream -
        locale -
        overwrite - - overwrite values modified from the user interface. This makes only sense during development
        importTarget - - RESOURCE_CATEGORIES.DB_ENTITY or RESOURCE_CATEGORIES.UI_TEXT
        initBoxResources - do not overwrite box resources (status, item type by upgrade)
